instructions.title: How To Delete Your Subscription Account From Ancestry
instructions.before: If you signed up for a paid subscription account with ancestry.com you must navigate through the website to delete your account.
instructions.after: Next you will have to delete your Registered Guest Account to finish deleting your entire account.
thingsToRemember: Once your subscription is canceled, you'll still have an account with Ancestry as a registered guest. Registered guest accounts are free and provide you with access to many resources on the site.
If you don't receive a cancellation email within 30 minutes of canceling your subscription, click your name or username and select Your Account. Make sure the page says your subscription is canceled.
Unless you delete them, any trees you’ve created in your account will remain on the site whether or not you have a subscription

steps: Go to the Ancestry Website. If you're already logged in, doing so will open your Ancestry home page.
Click your username in the top-right corner
Click the Cancel subscription link beneath Subscription Options
Scroll to the bottom of the page and select a cancellation reason, then click Continue

instructions.title: How To Delete Your Registered Guest Account From Ancestry
instructions.before: In order to delete your account you must send an email to socialsupport@ancestry.com requesting the deletion of your Registered guest account from the email address you set your account up on and Ancestry.com will take care of this for you.
thingsToRemember: Account deletion permanently erases all your personal data from the systems, and it will no longer be accessible.
Unless you delete them, any trees you’ve created in your account will remain on the site whether or not you have a subscription
